sub_title: Owner of Mondesign, Performing/Visual Arts, Produce, Film, Choreography and Design mmondesign.com
summary:
Short CV: Monique van Kerkhof has returned to the Netherlands, Maastricht, since 2012, after living abroad most of her life. She worked as a cultural entrepreneur and in visual/performing arts in cities as Barcelona, New York and Tokyo, She created projects in Egypt, Tunisia, Macedonia and West Africa.
Monique started her own company MONDESIGN as a cultural entrepreneur and in visual and performing arts in Tokyo since 2002.
Born in Nijmegen, Holland. Most of her youth she lived in Maastricht, she moved to Amsterdam at an age of 17 and got involved in Modern Dance. She left for Spain, when 22 years old to study Spanish and continuing dancing in Barcelona at ‘La Fabrica’. In 1985 she moved to New York City studying at the ‘Alvin Nikolais Dance School’ and at  the ‘Merce Cunningham Studio’ (She received a scholarship from Merce Cunningham)

PRESS RELEASE
During the Realtime International Film Festival in Lagos, Nigeria, a production by the Dutch artist Monique van Kerkhof in the category of music films was voted the best.
The short film "Follow Me Down Again" by Monique van Kerkhof is an adaptation of dance fragments and street recordings. Most of them were recorded during the dress rehearsal for a spectacular dance performance during the museum night in 2016 in Bookstore Dominicanen. The film was produced last year 2018.and 2 winning prizes have been awarded in Bombay as "award winner of best film director and best film". In addition, her film team received five nominations. Her film has been nominated 30 times so far, including Hollywood New Directors Film Festival in London, Amsterdam and Moscow. 
Monique van Kerkhof has developed into a multidisciplinary artist. In addition to choreography, she is also involved with film, music, dance, theater, installations, graphic design and product design in which an impressive oeuvre has been built up.
Her dance performance and short film "Follow Me Down Again" are inspired by the mythology of Icarus. About life enthusiasm and risk; trial and error whereby a connection is made with the quote "Hell is the place where nothing connects" by writer T.S Eliot. Monique van de Kerkhof on this: “life consists of falling and getting up again and again. Who gets up again, connects with people. When you are no longer connected to people, life is like hell ”. The music in the film was composed by Monique and performed in collaboration with students from the Maastricht Conservatory.

9700 bezoekers Dag van de Bouw A2
zondag 14 juni 10:51

Bekijk hier het fotoboek van de Dag van de Bouw 2015!

Bouwen aan mijn groene loper
Dansers verrasten de bezoekers door met ‘bouwstenen’ door de tunnel te trekken en zo de bovengrondse herinrichting te symboliseren. 
De dansgroep onder leiding van Monique van Kerkhof liet met een futuristisch optreden bomen ‘groeien’ in de tunnel. 
Dit met een knipoog naar de bomen in de parklaan anno 2017. Nadat straks 80% van de huidige auto’s ondergronds zijn, gaan het bovengronds richting groen. 
 www.mijngroeneloper.nl.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Monique', 'last_name': 'van Kerkhof', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Mondesign, Performing/Visual Arts, Produce, Film, Choreography and Design mmondesign.com'}]}, {'title': 'Tunnel Art project To', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'description': "Location: The Metropolitan Area Outer Underground Discharge Channel, Kasukabe, Saitama, Japan.
Description: The concept is to design a restricted field of vision in which the peripheral is limited. Only objects directly in line with the eyes can be seen, creating a series of segmented views. For this performance, the diagonal lines are important markers, since the diagonal                         paths at the performance space guide the audience's eyes to one particular perspective where one particular movement is to be seen. more under performance/tunnelvision
